ArticleTitle.sentence: Regulation of the Ets-related transcription factor Elf-1 by binding to the retinoblastoma protein.

event.clue: Regulation of the Ets-related transcription factor Elf-1 by binding to the retinoblastoma protein.
Regulation of the Ets-related transcription factor Elf-1 by binding to the retinoblastoma protein.

AbstractText.sentence: The retinoblastoma gene product (Rb) is a nuclear phosphoprotein that regulates cell cycle progression.

event.clue: The retinoblastoma gene product (Rb) is a nuclear phosphoprotein that regulates cell cycle progression.

AbstractText.sentence: Elf-1 is a lymphoid-specific Ets transcription factor that regulates inducible gene expression during T cell activation.

event.clue: Elf-1 is a lymphoid-specific Ets transcription factor that regulates inducible gene expression during T cell activation.

AbstractText.sentence: In this report, it is demonstrated that Elf-1 contains a sequence motif that is highly related to the Rb binding sites of several viral oncoproteins and binds to the pocket region of Rb both in vitro and in vivo.

event.clue: In this report, it is demonstrated that Elf-1 contains a sequence motif that is highly related to the Rb binding sites of several viral oncoproteins and binds to the pocket region of Rb both in vitro and in vivo.

AbstractText.sentence: Elf-1 binds exclusively to the underphosphorylated form of Rb and fails to bind to Rb mutants derived from patients with retinoblastoma.

event.clue: Elf-1 binds exclusively to the underphosphorylated form of Rb and fails to bind to Rb mutants derived from patients with retinoblastoma.
Elf-1 binds exclusively to the underphosphorylated form of Rb and fails to bind to Rb mutants derived from patients with retinoblastoma.

AbstractText.sentence: Co-immunoprecipitation experiments demonstrated an association between Elf-1 and Rb in resting normal human T cells.

event.clue: Co-immunoprecipitation experiments demonstrated an association between Elf-1 and Rb in resting normal human T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: After T cell activation, the phosphorylation of Rb results in the release of Elf-1, which is correlated temporally with the activation of Elf-1-mediated transcription.

event.clue: After T cell activation, the phosphorylation of Rb results in the release of Elf-1, which is correlated temporally with the activation of Elf-1-mediated transcription.

AbstractText.sentence: Overexpression of a phosphorylation-defective form of Rb inhibited Elf-1-dependent transcription during T cell activation.

event.clue: Overexpression of a phosphorylation-defective form of Rb inhibited Elf-1-dependent transcription during T cell activation.

AbstractText.sentence: These results demonstrate that Rb interacts specifically with a lineage-restricted Ets transcription factor.

event.clue: These results demonstrate that Rb interacts specifically with a lineage-restricted Ets transcription factor.

AbstractText.sentence: This regulated interaction may be important for the coordination of lineage-specific effector functions such as lymphokine production with cell cycle progression in activated T cells.

event.clue: This regulated interaction may be important for the coordination of lineage-specific effector functions such as lymphokine production with cell cycle progression in activated T cells.
